alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 6:56AM CST until February 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River at Bigbee For the Tombigbee River...including Bigbee...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bigbee. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding of low-lying agricltural land is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM CST Wednesday was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
